page.title: 02St.Andrew's Church
page.content: St.Andrew's Church was built in the 10th century about 50 years before the Norman Conquest.It is built mainly of flint with a lead roof. The Chancel was rebuilt in 1845 for the price of Â£800.It was built in 15th century style with an open roof, plastered walls and a tiled floor.In 1585 the first bell was re-cast and by the end of the 17th century there were two other bells. At the East end of the South aisle is the 'Walker' two manual and pedal organ built in 1880 and noted for its sweet and mellow tone. The Tower, which was rebuilt in 1704, is in three stages. There are now five bells which are rung from ground level.
